title-group.article-title: Clio's redress: renewing the new history

ref.mixed-citation: Marc Bloch to Lucien Febvre, 29 Sept. 1929. Quoted in Carole Fink, Marc Bloch. A Life in History (Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 1989), 128.
Certeau's texts are abbreviated as follows: AH—L'Absent de l'histoire (Paris, Mame, 1973);
FC—radio talk for France-Culture, 31.7.78, in Dosse 1994;
FH—Faire de l'histoire (Paris, Gallimard, 1974);
PL—La Possession de Loudun, (Paris, Julliard, 1970);
WH—The Writing of History (New York, Columbia University Press, 1988).
Paul Ricoeur, Temps et récit III (Paris, Editions du Seuil, 1985), translated by Kathleen Blarney and David Pellauer (Chicago. University of Chicago Press, 1985),
Tom Conley, Translator's Introduction to Michel de Certeau, The Writing of History (New York. Columbia University Press, 1988).
François Dosse. Paul Ricoeur, les sens d'une vie (Paris, Editions de la Découverte, 1997), 570.
Luce Giard, Introduction: 'Opening the Possible' in CP, ix-X.

François Dosse. L'Histoire en miettes. Des 'Annales à la nouvelle histoire (Paris, Editions La Découverte, 1987), translated by Peter V. Conroyjr. New History in France. The Triumph of the Annales (Urbana and Chicago, University of Illi- nois Press, 1994).
Annales d'histoire économique et sociale founded by Marc Bloch and Lucien Febvre in 1929, retitled Annales: Economies, Sociétés, Civilisations in 1946.
And 'rebaptizeď in France by the 1980s (Dosse, Op. cit . 1997, 568).
Lynn Hunt (ed.) The New Cultural History. (Berkeley and Los Angeles, University of California Press, 1989);
Philippe Carrard. Poetics of the New History. French Historical Discourse from Braudel to Chartier (Baltimore and London, The Johns Hopkins Press, 1992).
Gilles Lipovestsky, L'Ere du vide (Gallimard, Paris, 1983).
François Dosse, Histoire du structuralisme, tome I: Le Champ du signe, (Paris, La Découverte, 1991);
François Dosse, L'Empire du sens: l'humanisation des sciences humaines (Paris. La Découverte, 1995);
François Dosse, Paul Ricoeur. Les sens d'une vie (Paris, La Découverte, 1997).

RRH—François Dosse, 'Paul Ricoeur et l'écriture de l'histoire ou comment Paul Ricoeur révolutionne l'histoire', translated as 'Paul Ricoeur and History Writing, or How Paul Ricoeur Revolutionized History'; Cahiers de recherche sociologique 26, (1996), 139-169.
Dosse, History of Structuralism I, 24.
Luce Fontaine-de Visscher, Phénomène ou structure? Essai sur le langage chez Merleau-Ponty (Bruxelles, Faculté Universitaire Saint Louis, 1974),
James Schmidt, Maurice Merleau-Ponty. Between Phenomenology and Stucturalism (Macmillan, 1985),

James M.Edie's Introduction to his post- humous collection of essays by Maurice Merleau-Ponty, The Primacy of Perception and Other Essays on Phenomenological Psychology, the Philosophy of Art, History and Politics (Evanston. Northwestern University Press, 1964).
Dosse, History of Structuralism I, 264-272.
FH, quoted in Dosse, Annales, 3. For the link with structuralism, cf Claude Lévi-Strauss, Structural Anthropology vol. 2, translated by Monique Layton (Harmondsworth. Penguin Book, 1978), 18
Claude Lévi-Strauss, L'Identité (Paris. Quadrige/PUF, 1977), 9. (my translation).
FC in Dosse, Annales 153.
In 1997 Dosse acknowledges Certeau's works as among 'the best books of reflection on history'. (PR, 568).
Fink. Op. cit., 345, summing up 342-345.
John Keegan, The Battle for History. Re-fighting World War II (London, Pimlico, 1995), 51-52.
CP, viii.
Roger Chartier, 'Texts, Prints, Readings' quoting PEL, 165 in Lynn Hunt, Op. cit. (1989), 156.
CP, viii.
'Ethics as First Philosophy' in Sean Hand (ed.), The Levinas Reader (Oxford, Blackwell, 1989).
Alan Sheridan (Lon- don, Tavistock Publications, 1977), 309.

'Lacan, an Ethics of Speech' (H 63-4), also Elisabeth Roudinesco, Jacques Lacan & Co. A History of Psychoanalysis in France, 1 925-Î985, translated, with Foreword, by Jeffrey Mehlman (Chicago. University of Chicago Press, 1986), 205.
Tom Conley. 'Afterword: A Creative Swarm' in CP, 152.
Robert Rapley, A Case of Witchcraft. The Trial of Urbain Grandier (McGill-Queen's University Press, 1998).
Later Certeau will study this spiritual Jesuit in detail, referring to him as 'my guardian' (MF 2).
Michel Foucault, Discipline and Punish. The Birth of the Prison, translated from the French by Alan Sheridan (Harmondsworth, Penguin Books, 1979), 3.
Claude Lévi-Strauss, Inaugural Lesson to the Collège de France of 1960, 'The Scope of Social Anthropology', in Structural Anthropology, 15, 18.

'The Language of Violence', published in 1973 in Le Monde Diplomatique.

Ibid.
Une Philosophie de l'ambiguïté. L'existentialisme de Maurice Merleau-Ponty (Louvain, Paris, Nauwelaerts, 1978), 298, (my translation).
M. C. Dillon, Merleau-Ponty 's Ontology (Bloomington and Indianapolis, Indiana University Press, 1988), 155:
Maurice Merleau-Ponty, Humanism and Terror, translated by John O'Neill (Boston, 1969) and Adventures of the Dialectic, translated by Joseph Bien (Evanston, Northwestern University Press, 1973).

H-G. Gadamer, Truth and Method (London, Sheed and Ward, 1985), 242-243,

Paul Ricoeur, discussing Time and Narrative with Carlos Oliviera, University of Munich, during winter 1986-87, in Christian Bouindhomme, Rainer Rochlitz, 'Temps et réciť de Paul Ricoeur en débat (Paris, Editions du Cerf, 1990), 32, (my translation).
CR: Charles E. Reagan, Paul Ricoeur. His Life and His Work (Chicago and London, The University of Chicago Press, 1996);
IA: Paul Ricoeur, Intellectual Autobiography in V;
NR: Jean-Pierre Changeux et Paul Ricoeur, La Nature et la règle (Paris, Editions Odile Jacob, 1998);
OA:Olivier Abel, La promesse et la règie (Paris, Les Editions Michaion, 1 996);

V: Frans D. Vansina, Bibliography of Paul Ricoeur: A Primary and Secondary Sys- tematic Bibliography, compiled by Frans D. Vansina and Paul Ricoeur in Lewis Edwin Hahn (ed), The Philosophy of Paul Ricoeur, The Library of Living Philosophers Volume XXII (Chicago and La Salle Illinois, Open Court, 1995).
CI: Paul Ricoeur, The Conflict of Interpretations (Evanston, Northwestern University Press, 1970);
EM: Paul Ricoeur, 'Emmanuel Mounier, a personalist philosopher' in History and Truth;
HMO: Paul Ricoeur, 'Histoire, mémoire, oubli', Les Revues parlées , Centre Beaubourg, 24 janvier, 1990;
HT: Paul Ricoeur, History and Truth, translated by Charles Kelbley (Evanston Illinois, Northwestern University Press, 1965; Fr. 1955);
LM: Paul Ricoeur, Le Mai Un défi à la philosophie et à la théologie (Genève, Labor et Fides, Centre Protestant d'Etudes, 1986);
PRGM: Paul Ricoeur -Gabriel Marcel, Entretiens (Paris, Aubier Montaigne, 1968);
ZL: Paul Ricoeur, The Contribution of French Historiography to the Theory of History ; The Zaharoff Lecture 1978-9 (Oxford, The Clarendon Press, 1980).
